description: two women seated at a table outdoors with a standing man with a moustache, holding a bottle, at right; woman in foreground holds a glass for the baby on her lap to drink; other figures in middle ground and background, including a girl wearing a checked blouse leaning over the back of a bench, seen from back; printed in salmon pink and green
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription, Edition and Stamp

LLC, in pencil: [22757]; LRC,in pencil: [no 27]; URC, in pencil: [LB. 302]; on back, in pencil: [2148]
markings: LRC, in pencil: [Tir. 27 Ed. (?)]; LRC, impressed in paper: [ED SAGOT / Editeur / PARIS]
provenance: [Eric G. Carlson, New York, until 1995; sold in July for PROO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1995-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LRC, in pencil: [A Lepère]; on back, in pencil: [Dimanche à la guinguette]
title: Sunday at the Tavern
